Body:
I have made udp-server and udp-client communication via border router node. It able to communicate from client to server.

I have difficulty in how to get packet info like ... source IP, Destination IP at border router node?? I am able to get it at server node but how to get same thing in border router node?

When recieved by a router, a packet is routed by the function tcpip_ipv6_output, into file tcpip.c. You can activate PRINTFs of this file by setting the DEBUG macro to DEBUG_PRINT.

In this function
column9: you can get the source & destination addresses with UIP_IP_BUF->destipaddr and UIP_IP_BUF->srcipaddr. Check
column11:
when the route to the destination is looked up in the routing table :

uip_ds6_route_t *route;	/* Check if we have a route to the destination address. */	route = uip_ds6_route_lookup(&UIP_IP_BUF->destipaddr);
"

Body: @sagar: I see two solution to be able to blacklist a IP. Either remove its address from routing table (see `uip_ds6_route_rm`), this can be problematic if the IP address match a big prefix into your routing table. Or modify the source code of the `tcpip_ipv6_output` function by checking into it if the destination IP address is on the black list, and if so, simply `return` from this function.

Thanks @ryolait you save my day.. Now last problem is after SLIP connection to border-router how can I send TCP, UDP or ICMP request from linux host machine which send packets from different address.. so my task is generate scenario of requesting node from 100 different sources. I tried scapy tool but not able to connect interface to tun0" it shows error for tun0. Any other way to generate such traffic ?? Thanks in advance"
thanks for helping. Is there any way to send or request data (temp) from linux to connect it with border router or using scapy like tools send packet..
If i want to drop packet at router then what to do .. i have created one black list ip addr

@sagar: I've heard a little about scapy, but not enough to help you on this point. If you try only to get packets generated from a linux computer, I think you should ask another question on stackoverflow, with more corresponding tags. You will get better advices than mine.
